discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The key measure of a CSM is to address the business outcomes of the customers and also help realize the business potential of the Technology OEMs.
C is correct

Selected Answer: D
C is the correct one.

Selected Answer: C
C is correct
Correct C

choices.C: IT is increasingly adopting new consumption models. In a subscription economy, customers can cancel subscriptions if business value and tangible outcomes are not realized. The CSM ensures that the customer's business outcomes are achieved with the shortest time to value.
choices.A: Service organizations must evolve from a ג€break fixג€ business model to proactive and pre-emptive services that help prevent problems for customers before they arise and accelerate solution adoption. The CSM advises and professional services team on the best services to position.
choices.D: The accelerated pace of innovation in the era of the Internet of Things confuses many customers. A CSM helps sales position the right technologies that will accelerate success for their business.
choices.B: IT budgets are shifting to line of business decision makers who want to understand the business outcomes from technology investments before they purchase. The CSM supports sales with use cases and testimonials for proposed solutions.

Selected Answer: A
A. Lack of integration with other products. Untrained user group is a people barrier.
A. lack of integration with other products
A. lack of integration with other products

Selected Answer: A
A. lack of integration with other products.
is an obstacle related to the technical aspects of a product or service that can prevent a customer from successfully adopting and using the product or service. A lack of integration with other products or systems is an example of a technical adoption barrier. It can be difficult for a customer to adopt and use a product effectively if it does not integrate well with other systems or tools that they are using.
B, C &D are also obstacles that can prevent successful adoption and usage of a product or service, but they do not specifically relate to the technical aspects of the product or service.

choices.A: lack of integration with other products

questions.question_text: What is a technical adoption barrier?

The customer has a new leadership team that expresses concern over the lack of adoption of a purchased solution. Which two activities must the Customer Success Manager initiate to mitigate this risk? (Choose two.)

choices.C: Examine solution pricing with the Renewals Manager.
choices.A: Create a new Health Index dashboard with the Sales team.
choices.E: Review the original business case and reassess desired outcomes with the new leadership team.
choices.B: Evaluate the customer’s expertise in managing the purchased solution.
choices.D: Schedule Quarterly Business Review with the new leadership team.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: DE
I swear some of these "correct" answers are just random selections designed to spark annoyance among those that have paid for access to this.......

D. Schedule Quarterly Business Review with the new leadership team.
E. Review the original business case and reassess desired outcomes with the new leadership team.

Selected Answer: DE
Review the original business case and reassess desired outcomes with the new leadership team, and Schedule Quarterly Business Review with the new leadership team.
C. loss of project sponsor
I also think the correct answer should be C. loss of project sponsor. Once there is no sponsor at customer side, they hesitate to do anything and it can lead delays time to value

Selected Answer: C
Without a project sponsor, there may be delays in decision-making, difficulty in securing necessary resources, and a lack of alignment between the project goals and the overall business strategy.
